summary: This is a cover letter from the Department of Justice Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) to Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, transmitting the OPR Report of Investigation into the Southern District of Florida's handling of the 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. The letter notes the public release of the Executive Summary and the potential for the full report to be released to Congress or via FOIA requests.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of the OPR report cover letter, as the Acting U.S. Attorney for SDNY, which may have ongoing litigation related to the Epstein matter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual who was the subject of the 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation conducted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, which is the focus of the OPR report.

events.title: Federal Criminal Investigation of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A federal criminal investigation conducted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: OPR Report Transmittal and Public Release of Executive Summary
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of Professional Responsibility transmits its report on the SD Florida investigation to the SDNY U.S. Attorney and publicly releases the report's Executive Summary.

locations: 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Suite 3266 Washington, D.C. 20530 (DOJ OPR Office)
New York City, NY 10007 (United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
Southern District of Florida (Jurisdiction of the original Epstein investigation)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed an investigation into how the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida resolved its 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and interacted with victims.
The OPR report's Executive Summary was publicly released by the Department of Justice on November 12, 2020.
The full OPR report was not publicly released at that time but was to be provided to Congress upon request, with Congress having the option to release it publicly.
The matter had received 'extraordinary public attention' and was the subject of Congressional inquiries.
The report was sent to SDNY's Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss as it may be relevant to ongoing litigation handled by her office.
